Main Entities.category_desc:
Who/What is in focus?
Main character(s) clearly visible in foreground and has main focus.
Can be more than one

Location.category_desc: Where is this scene taking place?

Action.keywords_desc:
Fighting (physical)
Arguing (more intense/serious expressions while talking and both entities are actively involved)
Laughing (loud and explicit laughing)
Chuckling (laugh quietly or inwardly)
Listening (select only when this is the only action in this shot by the main entities)
Dressing Up (Wearing dress or coat or shoes etc.)
Action.category_desc:
What is the main action / interaction?
What is this person doing or what are these two people doing?
Can be more than one

Emotion.keywords_desc: Serious (Whenever a serious conversation is going on)
Emotion.category_desc:
Emotion evident from the face of the main character(s) seen
Emotion is expressed through action
Select ONLY if the emotion is VERY clear and EXPLICIT
If nothing particular and it is neutral emotion, do not select any emotion
Can be more than one if needed

Main Object.category_desc:
Main object of interaction between two people
Not just holding, but some significant action associated with that object
Object becomes the main thing in focus for some time

Camera Angle.keywords_desc:
Close (Face closeup where face is quite large, typically only one face)
Wide angle (All other angles)
Transit Scene (Scene depicting change of location
Camera Angle.category_desc:
How is the camera positioned?
Can be more than one

NumPeople.category_desc:
Max number of people being shown at any time in this shot
Count even if partially visible
Do not count same person more than once in a shot
It is NOT the total number of people seen throughout the shot
It is the max seen at any given time

SceneType.category_desc:
If this is a shot which shows the intro clip, does it have text overlay in or not?
Not selecting any keyword here means default scene type of normal episode
